Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory50.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Everyone has left except Ayla.'}
{3: 'Staring at the blank sky, Ayla suddenly begins to speak.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'I know you are more than just a narrator.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: "...I'm listening."}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'As we progressed through the movies, you began to sound more like a human. You even started to control yourself, trying not to relate with us emotionally.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Did you want to say something when Liv said the scenes of "The Evil Demon" looked like her old home?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: '...Well, that little girl had a tough life, just like I did.'}

{2: 'Ayla', 3: "Your childhood was very similar to Liv's, that's why you ran away from home. The funding from WGAA—which was called the United Nations Art Foundation back then—helped you become a director.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'You are no narrator. You are George D. Toro himself.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: 'George D. Toro died while shooting "Final Escape 2". How can I be George D. Toro?'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Because the Science Council\'s Memory Chip technology "just" started clinical trials at that time.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'There was no access record of the hidden section, but after Camp Inferno got discontinued, I found a writing record with unknown signature.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'That was when you transferred your memory into this disc. Am I right?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: 'A very good guess, but why would I do that?'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'You were bitter that Camp Inferno ended just like that.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'You want to see the first student to pass all the tests with your own eyes. You want to witness someone who can inherit your legacy.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: '...But I have no legacy for you to inherit now.'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: 'When you found this disc and plugged it to your console, I managed to connect to your network.'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: 'I learned about what happened next.'}

{2: 'Narration', 3: 'The Golden Age had ended. Humans retreated into corners, barely surviving. The "glorious and prosperous human society" no longer existed, right? Entertainment isn\'t needed in a post-apocalyptic world, and movies are no exception.'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'But I still want to keep them in this world.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Because the human society would be worthless without the spiritual treasure.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'You have been waiting for someone to see through your traps and disguise. Why else would you imprison yourself in this container?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'Artists are always greedy. Their dream has no limit, and they will keep searching until they die.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'My duty is to preserve the works of people like you, so artists in future can appreciate them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: "You are the winner, it's completely up to you. I'm only a memory, right?"}
{2: 'Narration', 3: 'I have passed the baton to the next generation like you.'}
{3: 'Ayla speaks with great confidence.'}

{2: 'Ayla', 3: "As a director, you didn't put any of your movies in the test. All we saw were other directors' works that you liked. I can only think that you weren't satisfied with your own works.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: "One day, the weirdos in the Science Council would be able to get you out from here. I'll make sure you enjoy the latest memory technologies of Babylonia.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ayla', 3: 'When you hold a video camera with your own hands again, I doubt you will ever say things like "I have passed the baton to you" again.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With that, Ayla logs out.'}
{2: 'Narration', 3: "...I'll look forward to it."}
